member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Content.IContentManager
member.summary:
Lightweight factory for creating and disposing ViewModels Abstracts DI container from Navigator - minimal interface
Purpose: - Decouple Navigator from specific DI implementation (Autofac) - Simple create/dispose operations only - No tracking, no caching, no events

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Content.IContentManager.CreateContentAsync(System.Type,Wpf.Contracts.Parameters.IViewModelParameters,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Create and initialize ViewModel by type
member.returns: Created and initialized ViewModel

member.summary: Create and initialize typed ViewModel
member.returns: Created and initialized ViewModel

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Content.IContentManager.DisposeContentAsync(Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Dispose ViewModel properly

member.summary: Navigator service - unified navigation and content management Combines responsibilities of INavigationService and IContentManager Resolves ViewModels, initializes them, and manages navigation stack

member.summary: Whether Navigator owns and disposes ViewModels Default: true (disposes on navigate away / ClearHistory) Set to false if ViewModels are cached/managed externally

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Helpers.WindowTokenIdComparer
member.summary: Comparer for WindowToken based solely on ID. Ensures consistent dictionary lookups even if token instances differ (e.g. due to immutability/updates).

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.DialogHost
member.summary: DialogHost implementation - provides dialog closing functionality DI-agnostic implementation that works with any IWindowManager

member.summary: Common DialogService implementation - DI-agnostic Only handles simple dialogs (MessageBox, confirmation, error) For custom dialog ViewModels, use IWindowManager.ShowDialogAsync()

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.IHasWindowId
member.summary: Interface for ViewModels that have a WindowId Used by DialogService to find owner window

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.NavigationJournal

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.NavigationService

member.summary: Navigation entry storing metadata about a navigation (not the ViewModel instance)

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.Navigator
member.summary:
Navigator using lightweight IContentManager Manages navigation history and activation itself No dependency on full ContentManager features
Benefits: - DI-agnostic (only depends on IContentManager interface) - Simpler implementation - Navigator controls activation/deactivation - Easy to swap DI containers (just implement IContentManager)

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.Navigator.NavigationEntry
member.summary: Navigation entry that stores metadata about a navigation Does NOT hold ViewModel instances to avoid memory leaks

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Implementation.Navigator.NavigationEntry.#ctor(System.Type,Wpf.Contracts.Parameters.IViewModelParameters)
member.summary: Navigation entry that stores metadata about a navigation Does NOT hold ViewModel instances to avoid memory leaks

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.Region
member.summary: Implementation of IRegion - manages views in a named region

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.RegionManager
member.summary: Implementation of IRegionManager - manages regions across the application Thread-safe implementation using ConcurrentDictionary

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.ShellContext
member.summary: Shell context implementation. Owns content lifecycle - resolves, initializes and disposes ViewModels. Provides IContentState for ShellViewModel binding. Uses INavigationJournal for navigation state.

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Implementation.ShellContext.Host
member.summary: IContentHost is now implemented directly by IWindowContext

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.ShellNavigator
member.summary: Shell navigator implementation. Delegates history to INavigationJournal and content creation to ShellContext. Used by StepViewModel for navigation and close requests.

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.ViewRegistry
member.summary: Registry for View mappings Singleton that holds all VM -> View mappings

member.summary: Gets all registered mappings (for diagnostics)

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Implementation.WindowContext
member.summary: Common WindowContext implementation - DI-agnostic Uses IWindowManager for all queries (no IWindowTracker dependency) Implements IContentHost for dialog close functionality

member.summary: Close dialog with typed result data (IContentHost implementation). For future use - allows closing dialog with result from non-ViewModel code. Note: Currently result is read from ViewModel, this is reserved for future scenarios.

member.summary: Windows's own scope (if ScopedWindow) - DI-agnostic NOTE: Deprecated - use Handle instead. This property is kept for backward compatibility. Returns IDisposable to support both Autofac and Microsoft DI.

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Metadata.WindowMetadata.WithWindow(System.Action{System.Windows.Window})
member.summary: Safely executes an action with the window if it's still alive. Prevents GC race conditions by holding a strong reference during the action.
member.param: Action to execute with the window
member.returns: True if window was alive and action was executed; false otherwise

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Metadata.WindowMetadata.WithWindow``1(System.Func{System.Windows.Window,``0},``0)
member.summary: Safely executes a function with the window if it's still alive and returns a result. Prevents GC race conditions by holding a strong reference during the function execution.
member.param: Function to execute with the window
Default value to return if window is not alive
member.returns: Function result if window was alive; defaultValue otherwise

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Metadata.WindowMetadata.WithViewModel(System.Action{Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel})
member.summary: Safely executes an action with the ViewModel if it's still alive. Prevents GC race conditions by holding a strong reference during the action.
member.param: Action to execute with the ViewModel
member.returns: True if ViewModel was alive and action was executed; false otherwise

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Metadata.WindowMetadata.WithViewModel``1(System.Func{Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel,``0},``0)
member.summary: Safely executes a function with the ViewModel if it's still alive and returns a result. Prevents GC race conditions by holding a strong reference during the function execution.
member.param: Function to execute with the ViewModel
Default value to return if ViewModel is not alive
member.returns: Function result if ViewModel was alive; defaultValue otherwise

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandle`1
member.summary:
Window handle for non-async (event-based) window management. Inherits from WindowHandleBase but does NOT auto-dispose when window is closed. Disposal is managed by WindowManagerBase to ensure proper cleanup order.
TScope is the DI-specific scope type (ILifetimeScope for Autofac, ITaggedScope for MS DI).

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandle`1.#ctor(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,`0,System.Windows.Window,Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel,System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Creates a new window handle.

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandle`1.#ctor(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,`0,System.WeakReference{System.Windows.Window},System.WeakReference{Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel},System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Creates a new window handle with pre-created WeakReferences.

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandle`1.OnWindowClosed(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when window is closed. For dialogs: Do NOT auto-dispose - WindowManagerBase.OnDialogWindowClosed handles disposal For normal windows: Auto-dispose to prevent memory leaks

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1
member.summary:
Abstract base class for window handles that own a DI scope. Prevents memory leaks by ensuring scope disposal. Uses WeakReferences to prevent holding references to disposed objects.
TScope is the DI-specific scope type (ILifetimeScope for Autofac, ITaggedScope for MS DI).
Derived classes can override OnWindowClosing and OnWindowClosed for custom behavior.

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.Token
member.summary: Window token (contains Id, ParentId, SessionId, Type, StatusColor).

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.Scope
member.summary: The DI scope for this window.

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.ViewModelType
member.summary: ViewModel type for this window.

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.IsDialog
member.summary: Whether this is a dialog window.

member.name: P:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.IsAlive
member.summary: Whether the window is still alive (not closed/disposed).

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.#ctor(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,`0,System.Windows.Window,Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel,System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Creates a new window handle.

member.name: M:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowHandleBase`1.#ctor(Wpf.Contracts.Tokens.WindowToken,`0,System.WeakReference{System.Windows.Window},System.WeakReference{Wpf.ViewModels.Abstractions.IViewModel},System.Type,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Creates a new window handle with pre-created WeakReferences.

member.summary: Update the token (e.g., when status changes).

member.summary: Finalizer - detects memory leaks! If this is called, it means Dispose() was never called = MEMORY LEAK.

member.summary: Disposes the handle synchronously.

member.name: T:Wpf.Services.Windows.WindowManagerBase`1
member.summary:
Base class for window management with internal tracking using WindowToken Provides core window lifecycle management and error handling
Uses internal Dictionary for tracking instead of IWindowTracker Uses WindowToken for type-safe identification
Derived classes implement DI-specific scope creation
